title: 109_hr2961
content: The Act titled "Sole Community Hospital Preservation Act of 2005" provides permanent hold harmless protection for sole community hospitals under the Medicare program. The Social Security Act is amended to provide permanent hold harmless protection for sole community hospitals regarding payment for covered OPD services. Additionally, a minimum base payment-to-cost ratio is established for determining the pre-BBA amount for these hospitals. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a minimum base payment-to-cost ratio for sole community hospitals when determining payment for covered OPD services. This ratio is set at the 75th percentile of payment-to-cost ratios for fiscal year 1996 for all hospitals designated as sole community hospitals in 2004. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to covered OPD services furnished on or after January 1, 2006. SEC. 4. REBASING FOR SOLE COMMUNITY HOSPITALS. Rebasing for sole community hospitals allows for a substitution in payment amounts under the Social Security Act, with a percentage split between subsection (d)(5)(D)(i) amounts and rebased target amounts for fiscal years 2006 and 2007. Rebasing for sole community hospitals involves a percentage split between subsection (d)(5)(D)(i) amounts and rebased target amounts for different fiscal years. The 'subparagraph (K) rebased target amount' is defined with adjustments to the base cost reporting period. The text discusses amendments to the Act regarding cost reporting periods and applicable percentage increases for discharges in fiscal years starting from 2007. Conforming amendments are made to Section 1886(b)(3) of the Act.
